case_data.name: Dahm v. City of Rock Island
case_data.plaintiff_description: Several anti-war protestors subjected to false arrest, malicious prosecution, and strip searches.
case_data.summary:
On March 24, 1986, eleven anti-war protesters filed this lawsuit under 42 U.S.C. ยง 1983 against the City of Rock Island, the Chief of the Rock Island Police Department, a matron at Rock County Jail, four Rock Island police officers, the City of Moline, the Moline Police Department Chief, eight Moline Police Officers, and Moline Police Department civilian clerks in the United States District Court for the Central District of Illinois. Plaintiffs, represented by the People's Law Office, sought compensatory damages, claiming they were the victims of false arrest, malicious prosecutions, and strip-searches.

On December 8, 1989, the Court (U.S. District Court Judge Michael M. Mihm) denied plaintiffs' motion for summary judgment.

On September 6, 1990, the Court (U.S. District Court Judge Mihm) denied defendants' motion for partial summary judgment based on immunity.

On September 28, 1990, the parties reached a settlement for $105,000. http://peopleslawoffice.com/other-notable-verdicts-and-settlements/

No additional information is available.
case_data.summary_short: This case was brought in 1986 in the U.S. District Court for the Central District of Illinois by anti-war protesters to challenge their arrests, prosecutions and strip searches by the cites of Rock Island and Moline. The case was settled with defendants paying $105,000 to the plaintiffs.
